answers.answer: Hi,It seems that your husband may have developed either some infections, or sensitivity to the medications he may be taking.The Small red spots on the legs may be due to an infection. Are they tender or painful? Does it have any discharge? How long has your husband have Diabetes? What medication was prescribed and what medication does he use for the Diabetes?I think you should talk back with the dentist to appraise him of the situation as well as inquire what meds were given to him at the time of the procedure.I think I would need more information on this from you to help you better.Best regards

question: My husband is diabetic. Last week he had some major dental work done, kept his blood sugar swinging wildly (usually down to 50). I've seem extreme pain affect his sugars, so I'm suspecting this is the problem. This morning he woke up with smallish red spots all over his lower legs, some on his thighs. They do not itch. A bright red.  Any ideas what this might be?
title: Red spots on legs/diabetes?
